questions.text: Which country has won the most FIFA World Cup titles?
questions.explanation: Brazil has won the FIFA World Cup a record 5 times (1958, 1962, 1970, 1994, 2002).

questions.text: How many players are on a standard basketball team on the court at one time?
questions.explanation: Each basketball team has 5 players on the court at a time.

questions.text: In which year were the first modern Olympic Games held?
questions.explanation: The first modern Olympic Games were held in Athens, Greece in 1896.

questions.text: What is the maximum score possible in a single frame of bowling?
questions.explanation: In the 10th frame, a bowler can score up to 30 points by rolling three consecutive strikes.

questions.text: Which tennis player has won the most Grand Slam men's singles titles?
questions.explanation: Novak Djokovic holds the record for the most men's Grand Slam singles titles with 24.

questions.text: What sport is played at Wimbledon?
questions.explanation: Wimbledon is the oldest and most prestigious tennis tournament in the world.

questions.text: How many rings are on the Olympic flag?
questions.explanation: The Olympic flag has 5 interlocking rings representing the five continents.

questions.text: Which NBA player is known as 'His Airness'?
questions.explanation: Michael Jordan earned the nickname 'His Airness' for his incredible leaping ability.

questions.text: In baseball, how many strikes make an out?
questions.explanation: Three strikes result in a strikeout in baseball.

questions.text: Which country hosted the 2016 Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: The 2016 Summer Olympics were held in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

questions.text: What is the standard distance of a marathon?
questions.explanation: A marathon is 26.2 miles (42.195 kilometers).

questions.text: Which NFL team has won the most Super Bowls?
questions.explanation: The New England Patriots and Pittsburgh Steelers are tied with 6 Super Bowl wins each, but the Patriots have the most recent dynasty run.

questions.text: In golf, what term describes one stroke under par on a hole?
questions.explanation: A birdie is a score of one stroke under par on a single hole.

questions.text: Which swimmer has won the most Olympic gold medals?
questions.explanation: Michael Phelps won 23 Olympic gold medals, the most by any athlete in Olympic history.

questions.text: How many periods are in a standard NHL hockey game?
questions.explanation: A standard NHL hockey game consists of 3 periods of 20 minutes each.

questions.text: Which soccer player is known as 'The GOAT' and has won multiple Ballon d'Or awards?
questions.explanation: Lionel Messi has won a record 8 Ballon d'Or awards and is widely considered the greatest of all time.

questions.text: In which sport would you perform a 'slam dunk'?
questions.explanation: A slam dunk is a basketball move where a player jumps and forces the ball through the hoop.

questions.text: What is the highest possible break in a single frame of snooker?
questions.explanation: The maximum break in snooker is 147, achieved by potting all reds with blacks followed by all colors.

questions.text: Which athlete set the world record for the 100m sprint at 9.58 seconds?
questions.explanation: Usain Bolt set the 100m world record of 9.58 seconds at the 2009 World Championships in Berlin.

questions.text: How many holes are in a standard round of golf?
questions.explanation: A standard round of golf consists of 18 holes.

questions.text: Which city hosted the first Olympic Games to feature both Summer and Winter events?
questions.explanation: The 1900 Paris Olympics included some winter sports like figure skating, though separate Winter Games did not begin until 1924.

questions.text: In which year did the 'Miracle on Ice' occur at the Winter Olympics?
questions.explanation: The Miracle on Ice took place at the 1980 Winter Olympics in Lake Placid when the US hockey team defeated the Soviet Union.

questions.text: Which baseball player holds the all-time home run record in MLB?
questions.explanation: Barry Bonds holds the all-time MLB home run record with 762 career home runs.

questions.text: What is the term for a score of zero in tennis?
questions.explanation: In tennis, a score of zero is called 'love'.

questions.text: Which country is traditionally dominant in Olympic gymnastics?
questions.explanation: The Soviet Union/Russia has historically been the most dominant force in Olympic gymnastics with the most total medals.

questions.text: How many points is a touchdown worth in American football?
questions.explanation: A touchdown is worth 6 points in American football, with the option for a 1-point extra kick or 2-point conversion.

questions.text: Which Grand Slam tennis tournament is played on clay?
questions.explanation: The French Open (Roland Garros) is played on clay courts.

questions.text: In soccer, what does FIFA stand for?
questions.explanation: FIFA stands for Federation Internationale de Football Association, founded in 1904.

questions.text: Which NBA team has won the most championships?
questions.explanation: The Boston Celtics have won the most NBA championships with 18 titles.

questions.text: What is the diameter of a basketball hoop in inches?
questions.explanation: A standard basketball hoop has an inside diameter of 18 inches.

questions.text: Which golfer has won the most major championships?
questions.explanation: Jack Nicklaus holds the record with 18 major championship victories.

questions.text: What sport uses a shuttlecock?
questions.explanation: Badminton is played with a shuttlecock (also called a birdie).

questions.text: Which country won the first-ever FIFA World Cup in 1930?
questions.explanation: Uruguay won the first FIFA World Cup in 1930, which was also hosted in Uruguay.

questions.text: In boxing, how many rounds are in a standard professional championship bout?
questions.explanation: Modern professional championship boxing matches are scheduled for 12 rounds.

questions.text: Which Formula 1 driver holds the record for most World Championships?
questions.explanation: Lewis Hamilton and Michael Schumacher share the record with 7 World Championships each, though Hamilton achieved it more recently.

questions.text: In cricket, how many players are on each team?
questions.explanation: Each cricket team has 11 players on the field.

questions.text: Which city hosted the 2020 Summer Olympics (held in 2021)?
questions.explanation: The 2020 Summer Olympics were held in Tokyo, Japan, delayed to 2021 due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

questions.text: What is the only Grand Slam tennis tournament played on grass?
questions.explanation: Wimbledon is the only Grand Slam tournament played on grass courts.

questions.text: In the NBA, how far is the three-point line from the basket at its farthest point?
questions.explanation: The NBA three-point line is 23 feet 9 inches from the basket at the arc's farthest point.

questions.text: Which baseball player was known as 'The Sultan of Swat'?
questions.explanation: Babe Ruth was nicknamed 'The Sultan of Swat' for his legendary home run hitting.

questions.text: What color card in soccer indicates a player is sent off the field?
questions.explanation: A red card means the player is ejected from the game and cannot be replaced.

questions.text: Which country has won the most Olympic gold medals in history?
questions.explanation: The United States has won the most Olympic gold medals of any country in history.

questions.text: In American football, how long is the playing field in yards?
questions.explanation: The playing field is 100 yards long, with two 10-yard end zones making the total field 120 yards.

questions.text: Which sport is Tiger Woods associated with?
questions.explanation: Tiger Woods is one of the greatest professional golfers of all time.

questions.text: How many sets does a player need to win to take a men's singles match at Wimbledon?
questions.explanation: Men's singles at Wimbledon is best of 5 sets, so a player needs to win 3 sets.

questions.text: Which track and field event involves throwing a heavy metal ball?
questions.explanation: Shot put involves throwing (putting) a heavy spherical metal ball as far as possible.

questions.text: Which team won the first-ever Super Bowl in 1967?
questions.explanation: The Green Bay Packers won the first Super Bowl (Super Bowl I) on January 15, 1967.

questions.text: In volleyball, how many times can a team touch the ball before it must cross the net?
questions.explanation: A volleyball team is allowed a maximum of 3 touches before the ball must cross the net.

questions.text: What is the name of the trophy awarded to the NHL champion?
questions.explanation: The Stanley Cup is awarded to the NHL playoff champion each year.

questions.text: Which Olympic sport involves performing routines on a balance beam?
questions.explanation: The balance beam is an apparatus in artistic gymnastics.

questions.text: In baseball, how many bases are there on the diamond?
questions.explanation: A baseball diamond has 4 bases: first base, second base, third base, and home plate.

questions.text: Which legendary basketball player wore the number 23 for the Chicago Bulls?
questions.explanation: Michael Jordan famously wore number 23 for the Chicago Bulls.

questions.text: What is the regulation weight of a men's shot put in kilograms?
questions.explanation: The men's shot put weighs 7.26 kilograms (16 pounds).

questions.text: Which soccer club has won the most UEFA Champions League titles?
questions.explanation: Real Madrid holds the record with 15 UEFA Champions League titles.

questions.text: In which Olympic event do athletes compete in swimming, cycling, and running?
questions.explanation: The triathlon consists of swimming, cycling, and running.

questions.text: Who was the first African American to play in Major League Baseball?
questions.explanation: Jackie Robinson broke the color barrier when he debuted for the Brooklyn Dodgers on April 15, 1947.

questions.text: What is the scoring system in tennis after deuce?
questions.explanation: After deuce (40-40), a player must win by two points: first advantage, then the game.

questions.text: Which country invented the sport of rugby?
questions.explanation: Rugby originated at Rugby School in Warwickshire, England, in the 19th century.

questions.text: How many players are on a standard soccer team on the field?
questions.explanation: Each soccer team fields 11 players including the goalkeeper.

questions.text: Which athlete won 9 Olympic gold medals in track and field?
questions.explanation: Carl Lewis won 9 Olympic gold medals in sprints and long jump across 4 Olympic Games.

questions.text: What is the term for three consecutive strikes in bowling?
questions.explanation: Three consecutive strikes in bowling is called a 'turkey'.

questions.text: Which heavyweight boxer retired undefeated with a 49-0 record?
questions.explanation: Rocky Marciano retired as the only undefeated heavyweight champion in boxing history with a 49-0 record.

questions.text: In which sport is the 'Ryder Cup' contested?
questions.explanation: The Ryder Cup is a biennial golf competition between teams from Europe and the United States.

questions.text: Which NBA player holds the record for most career points scored?
questions.explanation: LeBron James surpassed Kareem Abdul-Jabbar in 2023 to become the NBA's all-time leading scorer.

questions.text: What is the width of a soccer goal in feet?
questions.explanation: A regulation soccer goal is 24 feet (8 yards) wide and 8 feet high.

questions.text: In the decathlon, how many events does an athlete compete in?
questions.explanation: The decathlon consists of 10 track and field events over two days.

questions.text: Which NHL player holds the all-time record for most career goals?
questions.explanation: Wayne Gretzky holds the NHL record with 894 career goals.

questions.text: Which country has the most Wimbledon men's singles titles historically?
questions.explanation: Australia and Great Britain have produced the most Wimbledon men's singles champions historically.

questions.text: What does 'NBA' stand for?
questions.explanation: NBA stands for the National Basketball Association, founded in 1946.

questions.text: In which year did Serena Williams win her first Grand Slam title?
questions.explanation: Serena Williams won her first Grand Slam title at the 1999 US Open.

questions.text: How many innings are in a standard professional baseball game?
questions.explanation: A standard Major League Baseball game consists of 9 innings.

questions.text: Which country won the 2022 FIFA World Cup?
questions.explanation: Argentina won the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar, defeating France in the final.

questions.text: What is the height of a standard basketball hoop from the floor?
questions.explanation: A regulation basketball hoop is 10 feet (3.05 meters) from the floor.

questions.text: Which gymnast won 4 gold medals at the 2016 Rio Olympics?
questions.explanation: Simone Biles won 4 gold medals and 1 bronze at the 2016 Rio Olympics.

questions.text: In golf, what is the term for two strokes under par on a single hole?
questions.explanation: An eagle is a score of two strokes under par on a hole.

questions.text: Which quarterback has won the most Super Bowls?
questions.explanation: Tom Brady won a record 7 Super Bowls during his career.

questions.text: What is the oldest tennis Grand Slam tournament?
questions.explanation: Wimbledon is the oldest Grand Slam tournament, first held in 1877.

questions.text: Which country has won the most Rugby World Cup titles?
questions.explanation: South Africa has won the Rugby World Cup 4 times (1995, 2007, 2019, 2023).

questions.text: In Olympic swimming, what is the longest individual race?
questions.explanation: The 1500m freestyle is the longest individual swimming event at the Olympics.

questions.text: Which MLB team has won the most World Series titles?
questions.explanation: The New York Yankees have won the most World Series titles with 27 championships.
